title: No trams between Bury and Manchester Victoria following points failure as Bury bus station is also closed - latest updates
text:
There are no trams running between Bury and Manchester Victoria (Photo: Mark Waugh) Share 
There are currently no trams running between Bury and Manchester Victoria. 
A points failure at Bury station is causing severe disruption to the Metrolink network this morning. 
Transport for Greater Manchester have made arrangements for tram passengers to use their tickets on bus services instead. 
Commuters can use tickets or passes on the 59, 97, 98, and 135 bus services. 
It is unclear when services will be back to normal at this stage. 
To add to the transport chaos, Bury bus station is also shut this morning due to a water leak. 
Bury bus services will be terminating and starting on Knowsley Street, near to Bury Town Hall. 07:30 People can access bikes at Bury Interchange Cycle Hub 
Staff are also manning the Bury Interchange Cycle Hub so users can access cycles. 07:29 Emergency electrical works underway 
TfGM have just told us Bury bus station has been shut due to a water leak and power issues. 
It is unknown if the Metrolink issues are connected to this. 
A statement from TfGM said: 
Due to an infrastructure fault, emergency electrical works are currently under way at Bury Interchange. This involves turning off the main power supply to the Interchange. 
There are currently no Metrolink services running between Manchester Victoria and Bury Interchange. Metrolink tickets will be accepted on the 135 and 98 bus services. 
All bus services running to and from Bury Interchange will continue to run, but will start and stop outside the Interchange until around 8am. 
First’s services will terminate and leave from outside the Town Hall and Rosso’s services will terminate and leave from Moss Street. 
The Travelshop is unable to sell tickets, so passengers are advised to allow more time for their journey. TfGM staff are on hand to advise passengers. From 8am there should be enough daylight to safely start and finish all bus journeys in the Interchange. 07:27 Bus station closed due to health and safety reasons 
The bus station in Bury has also been closed this morning. It is not yet known yet if it is linked to the tram problem. 07:26 No trams between Bury and Manchester Victoria 
Manchester Metrolink have tweeted: “Due to a points issue at Bury, we currently have no services operating between Bury & Victoria. We have ticket acceptance on the 59 98 & 135. 
“Bury line passengers: Ticket are being accepted on the 59, 97, 98, and 135 bus services.” Share
